decks.notes: The deck focuses on using Cephalid Illusionist, Nomads en-Kor, and a few other key cards to quickly mill through the deck, putting cards into the graveyard to set up for a combo win condition. The deck utilizes cards like Dread Return and Thassa's Oracle to win the game by either decking out the opponent or creating a win condition through a combo involving Cephalid Illusionist. Control elements like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares help protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to efficiently assemble its combo pieces and win the game before the opponent can stop it.

The deck focuses on utilizing combo pieces such as Nadu, Winged Wisdom and Nomads en-Kor to generate card advantage and potentially win the game in a single turn. It also includes versatile cards like Delighted Halfling and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath for additional value and protection. With a suite of powerful control cards like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares alongside card selection tools like Brainstorm and Ponder, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while assembling its own win conditions efficiently. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's strategy and provide access to various colors of mana.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the necessary combo pieces to unleash powerful spells and creatures onto the battlefield. By using cards like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal to generate mana, the deck aims to cast spells like Necrodominance and Soul Spike to overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Thoughtseize and Duress helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect the combo pieces. The key strategy is to ramp up fast and unleash devastating combos with cards like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Ancient Cellarspawn.

This Legacy combo deck revolves around using Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor to mill the library, triggering a win condition with Thassa's Oracle or Dread Return. The deck includes supporting cards like Nadu, Winged Wisdom and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to facilitate the combo. It also includes control elements like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to protect the combo pieces. Urza's Saga provides additional utility and the mana base supports the deck's strategy with fetch lands and a combination of dual lands.

This deck focuses on using efficient creatures and disruption spells to put pressure on the opponent while controlling the game tempo. The key strategy revolves around playing aggressive threats like Orcish Bowmasters and Nethergoyf while using cards like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also utilizes powerful spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect its creatures and counter opposing threats. By maintaining a balance between aggression and disruption, this deck aims to control the game and secure victory through tempo advantage.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively establish board presence by utilizing cheap and efficient creatures, as well as disruptive spells to control the opponent's resources. By combining powerful cards such as Reanimate and Thoughtseize with aggressive creatures like Nethergoyf and Dauthi Voidwalker, the deck aims to apply early pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck includes some recursion and graveyard interaction to provide additional value and resilience. Overall, this deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent and disrupt their strategy to secure a quick victory.

The deck revolves around assembling a powerful combo quickly using artifacts and mana acceleration cards to generate a lot of mana, allowing for explosive plays. Mystic Forge serves as a key engine, enabling the player to play cards from the top of their library. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Ugin, Karn, and The One Ring to provide additional value and control the board. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of powerful artifacts and spells, creating a dominating board state and winning the game.

The main concept of this Legacy Belcher combo deck is to quickly assemble the necessary cards for a fast and overwhelming win condition. By utilizing cards like Lotus Petal, Dark Ritual, and Lion's Eye Diamond, the deck aims to generate a large amount of mana to play cards like Goblin Charbelcher and Tendrils of Agony to finish off the opponent. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Thoughtseize and Duress to protect the combo, as well as ways to refill the hand with cards like Echo of Eons and Beseech the Mirror.

The deck revolves around assembling the Painter's Servant and Grindstone combo to mill the opponent's deck. It also utilizes Goblin Engineer and Goblin Welder to tutor for key pieces and disrupt opponents. With the support of cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Agatha's Soul Cauldron, the deck aims to control the game and win quickly through its combo. The addition of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds flexibility and consistency to the deck's strategy. Ultimately, the goal is to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent through a well-timed combo.

The main strategy of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's plays with cards like Force of Will, Swords to Plowshares, and Pithing Needle. The deck also aims to stifle the opponent's board presence with Torpor Orb and Dress Down, while setting up card advantage and filtering with cards like Brainstorm and Ponder. The deck utilizes powerful threats like Phyrexian Dreadnought and Nulldrifter to close out the game quickly, while also having a backup win condition in the form of Curie, Emergent Intelligence. The mana base is designed to support the diverse range of spells in the deck.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to quickly bring back high impact creatures from the graveyard, such as Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. This combo-oriented strategy allows the player to overwhelm their opponent with big threats while also disrupting their game plan with counter spells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck also includes card draw and selection with Brainstorm and Ponder, as well as disruption with Thoughtseize. The mana base is optimized for consistency and to support the deck's powerful spells.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with key creatures using cards like Entomb and Brainstorm, and then reanimate them with spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo and control the opponent's plays. The deck aims to efficiently bring out powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory in the early game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using Cloudposts and other land cards to play powerful spells and creatures such as Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, Eye of the Storms. The deck also utilizes counterspells like Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect its key pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, cards like Stock Up and Thundertrap Trainer help draw cards and find key pieces of the combo. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with massive threats and resource denial.

The key concept of this deck revolves around using the cards Cephalid Illusionist, Nomads en-Kor, and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to combo off and mill cards from the library to win the game. The deck also includes cards like Nadu, Winged Wisdom and Thassa's Oracle as win conditions. The deck is built around efficient card draw and control with Brainstorm, Force of Will, and Swords to Plowshares, while also utilizing the new card Urza's Saga to tutor for key pieces of the combo.

The deck revolves around using Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor to mill through your deck quickly, while also protecting your combo pieces with Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares. Utilizing Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Nadu, Winged Wisdom, the deck seeks to draw into key cards such as Thassa's Oracle or Dread Return to win the game. The inclusion of Urza's Saga provides additional utility and synergy with the combo pieces. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and efficiently to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponents while applying pressure with aggressive creatures and equipment. It aims to control the board with removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Thoughtseize, while using Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play. The deck also utilizes powerful synergies with cards like Stoneforge Mystic and Recruiter of the Guard to find key pieces like Kaldra Compleat and Phantom Blade. With Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion, the deck can generate extra value and outvalue opponents in longer games.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble a winning combination of cards quickly and efficiently using the Doomsday combo. This involves setting up a specific sequence of cards in order to win the game in one turn. The deck includes various spells and cantrips to dig for key pieces, as well as disruption spells to protect the combo. Additionally, the deck includes specific lands to help with mana fixing and consistency. The goal is to execute the combo as soon as possible while preventing the opponent from interfering with the plan.

The main focus of this Dragon Stompy deck is to disrupt the opponent's mana base and lock them out of casting spells with cards like Magus of the Moon, Blood Moon, and Chalice of the Void. By utilizing fast mana sources like Simian Spirit Guide and Chrome Mox, the deck aims to quickly deploy aggressive threats like Broadside Bombardiers and Pyrogoyf to put pressure on the opponent. Additionally, the deck includes powerful removal options like Fury and Sundering Eruption to deal with opposing threats and close out the game efficiently.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy with a combination of counter spells, hand disruption, and removal spells. It also includes card advantage and selection through cards like Brainstorm and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent with powerful threats like Thundertrap Trainer and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares. Additionally, the deck includes a mana denial aspect with cards like Wasteland to further disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing lands and control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan while slowly assembling a powerful combo with Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 indestructible creature. It also uses cards like Life from the Loam and Exploration to generate card advantage and mana ramp, while utilizing Mox Diamond and Boseiju, Who Endures to ensure smooth gameplay. The inclusion of utility lands like Karakas, Wasteland, and The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale allows for additional disruption and protection. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through resource management and strategic gameplay.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature plays supported by disruptive spells to maintain board control and pressure the opponent. Utilizing cards like Goblin Bombardment, Cabal Therapy, and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's strategy while quickly building a strong creature presence with cards like Amped Raptor, Guide of Souls, and Orcish Bowmasters. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Voice of Victory provide additional ways to push for game-ending damage. The mana base is optimized for consistency and includes versatile lands like Arid Mesa and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The deck revolves around utilizing artifacts and mana ramp to generate infinite mana and card advantage, allowing for explosive plays and locking out the opponent from being able to respond effectively. The key strategy involves assembling a combo involving Mystic Forge, cards like Voltaic Key and Manifold Key, and powerful artifacts like The One Ring and Karn, the Great Creator to create a dominant board state and win the game quickly. The deck aims to control the game with powerful artifacts and combo pieces to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

This deck focuses on using Nadu, Winged Wisdom's ability to draw cards whenever another creature is targeted to generate card advantage and create a combo with Nomads en-Kor to draw and play your entire deck in one turn. It also includes control elements like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to protect the combo pieces. The deck's mana base is designed to support the combo while also providing access to different colors of mana for utility cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath.

This deck aims to assemble the Painter's Servant and Grindstone combo to mill the opponent's deck. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mishra's Bauble help with card advantage and graveyard recursion. Pinnacle Emissary and Kappa Cannoneer provide additional control and disruption. The deck also includes various artifact acceleration like Mox Opal and Lotus Petal, along with protection in the form of Force of Will and Metallic Rebuke. The mana base is designed to support the combo pieces and enable quick setup of the win condition.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana quickly through cards like Lotus Petal and Lion's Eye Diamond to be able to cast multiple spells in a single turn, creating a storm count. This allows the player to win the game by casting a high storm count Tendrils of Agony or using Burning Wish to search for the necessary win condition. The deck also utilizes cards like Galvanic Relay and Echo of Eons to refill the hand and maintain momentum. The key strategy is to chain spells together efficiently to build up a lethal storm count.

The deck aims to generate a large amount of mana quickly with fast mana sources like Chrome Mox, Lion's Eye Diamond, and Lotus Petal. It uses spells like Dark Ritual and Infernal Tutor to search for and cast key combo pieces like Ad Nauseam and Tendrils of Agony. Veil of Summer protects the player's combo from disruption, and Wishclaw Talisman can tutor for specific cards needed for the combo. The deck also features disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Brainstorm for control. Ultimately, the goal is to assemble the combo pieces and win the game in a single explosive turn.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring back big creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier early in the game. It also includes control elements like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo and overwhelm the opponent with high-powered creatures while also maintaining a strong hand with cards like Brainstorm and Ponder. The mana base is designed for consistency and includes utility lands like Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base.
